all_fall.description: On Thanksgiving we were thankful for the four day weekend - no work, no school.  Just us, the fall foliage, and a massively delicious meal at the Joyce family's well-appointed table.
all_fall.title: All Fall

hike_01.description: The day after Thanksgiving saw us on a Joyce-ful hike in the ever-scenic Marin Headlands.
hike_01.title: Hike 1

hike_02.description: Milo has joined Felix in the cult of Keenan worship.  They both light up when they see him. And Keenan's been fantastic with them, holding their hands and pushing Milo in the stroller at turbo speed for miles.
hike_02.title: Hike 2

hike_03.description:
Milo LOVES hanging with the Joyces. He flashes them the most flirtatious smiles.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_03.title: Hike 3

hike_04.description:
Addicted to jumping, this one is.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_04.title: Hike 4

hike_06.description:
"Look Papa, a plane!" Milo got hip to grammar about a month ago, and is rapidly adding all those little words between the nouns and verbs.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_06.title: Hike 6

hike_07.description:
A mountain lion crouching in the bush?
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_07.title: Hike 7

hike_08.description:
No, it's a ravening FELIX!
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_08.title: Hike 8

hike_09.description:
Felix pretends to be a... fish? Bird? Turtle? He's old enough now that we can ask him. But he forgot, too.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_09.title: Hike 9

hike_10.description: Amanda takes photography in school.  Her pix of this hike were quite a bit better than our own
hike_10.title: Hike 10

hike_11.description:
Milo ran and ran and ran and ran and ran after Keenan.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_11.title: Hike 11

hike_12.description:
The only way to stop a Tickle Monster is with a dose of his own fiendish medicine.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_12.title: Hike 12

hike_14.description: Both boys stuck to Keenan like superglue on a Star Wars model.
hike_14.title: Hike 14

hike_15.description:
This hike, the Tennessee Valley Hike, ends at a pleasant pebbly beach on the Pacific Ocean.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_15.title: Hike 15

hike_16.description:
The creek at the beach afforded Dean the opportunity to pass on his love of dam building.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_16.title: Hike 16

hike_17.description:
No matter how hard Dean tries to escape, gravity binds him in its steely grip.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_17.title: Hike 17

hike_18.description:
Who's surgically attached to WHO, now?
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_18.title: Hike 18

hike_19.description:
Milo's happiest at snack time. Well, he's pretty darn happy a lot of times. Snack time is at least up there, on the happiness scale.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_19.title: Hike 19

hike_20.description:
The tiger pounces.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_20.title: Hike 20

hike_21.description:
Thinking about the structural integrity of the dam, no doubt.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
hike_21.title: Hike 21

zoo1.description: The San Francisco Zoo opened a new wing.  We went to check it out.  To our surprise, there are NO MORE ELEPHANTS! Whoever heard of a zoo without elephants?!
zoo1.title: Zoo 1

zoo2.description:
Santa was at the zoo. We heard he eats raw elf meat. They let him out of his cage to meet the kids.

When asked what they wanted for Christmas, Felix was decisive: "A scooter!" Milo took a while, then thoughtfully answered, "A cadeaux." (A present).
zoo2.title: Zoo 2

description:
Happy Thanksgiving!

Felix is busy doing "kindergarden school" homework most nights. Lots of mazes, which is improving his pencil grip and drawing skills. He's also working on his notebook of sounds. Each sound has a hand motion associated with it, like a fanning motion for "Ffff". We find pictures of things that start with each sound and paste it into the notebook. It's really working: he's increasingly aware of each sound in everyday conversation, as opposed to just when he's asked to think about it.

Milo has an eye for Starbucks coffee. We were in the car and Dean mentioned he'd like to stop at the next place. Twenty seconds later Milo shouted "Coffeeshop!" He had seen a small, tucked-away Starbucks logo whizzing by at sixty miles an hour. He also has a taste for lattes: Dean lets him have one lick at the foam on top, and Milo makes a big show of going "Mmmmmm!" and rubbing his tummy.

If you have a Windows computer, you can check out this video of Keenan chasing Milo on a hike.
title: November 26
